We let \(\begin{pmatrix} y \\ y' \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} x_1 \\ x_2 \end{pmatrix}\) so that

\[\begin{aligned} x_1' &= y' = x_2 \\ x_2' &= y'' = -ty' - t^2 y = -t x_2 - t^2 x_1\end{aligned}\]

We can now write the above in matrix notation \(\frac{d}{dt} \begin{pmatrix} x_1 \\ x_2 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 0 & 1 \\ -t^2 & -t \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} x_1 \\ x_2 \end{pmatrix}\). This is a first-order linear system as requested.
